subject: Gardening
title: Slugs: Decomposers Gone Rogue
description: A 60-second lesson on Slugs: Decomposers Gone Rogue.

hook.text: Gardeners hate slugs. But slugs are decomposersâ€”their job is recycling dead matter. Your lettuce just got in the way.

buildup.text: Most slug species prefer decaying organic matter over fresh plants. Only a few species cause serious garden damage.

discovery.text: The grey field slug and garden slug are the main culprits. Of 40+ UK slug species, fewer than 10 damage crops.

twist.text: Killing all slugs removes valuable decomposers. Targeted management of the few pest species is more effective.

climax.text: Understanding that most slugs are alliesâ€”not enemiesâ€”changes the management approach entirely.

punchline.text: Most slugs are recyclers. A few are criminals.

quiz.question: What proportion of slug species actually cause serious garden damage?
options: Nearly all slug species damage crops
Fewer than 10 out of 40+ species are significant crop pests
Exactly half of all slug species are harmful
